channel.title: I need help with combat please
channel.description: Hello everyone. I am new to java and coding and rsps. I am wanting to learn from scratch and found a blank source with pretty much nothing added except for orbs. There's no skills or anything. One of the things i can't seem to figure out is the combat. When I kill any npc, it always trains the attack skill. Ranged trains range but it won't train def if long range is selected. Magic wont will only train if u manually select each spell. Autocast wont work and if you use a staff, it wont use the spell. I just need some guidance as to how to fix this. Thanks.

item.title: I need help with combat please
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t know what all you’d have to edit, either.
As servers will vary with what code they have - however, most ones that came from the same base (Ex: Delta, PI) will have the most similarities (but this does not mean two servers released will be exactly identical).

If you’re on a 317 server, I’d assume the class would have “Combat” or “CombatAssistant” in the name.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with combat please

item.title: I need help with combat please
item.dc:creator: @dirtybubble dirtybubble
item.description:
@dirtybubble wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:554055”]If you are new to Java, then the worst thing you could (RSPS-wise) do is start with a blank source.

The reason that is, is because if there’s nothing there, you have nothing to learn from.

Example:
A server that has the logout packet functioning correctly would be a good benefit for someone who is attempting to understand the logout packet. They’d be able to reference that code as they write their own.

Combat is also one of the more complex sides of RSPS, so you may want to hold out on that until you know what you’re doing.
Start small. Start with the easy skills, like thieving from an object. Then move onto bigger once you’re better.[/quote]

ya that makes sense. I see your point there. I just figured it would be easier to have a blank source and use other sources to look off of and try to figure out how its built then make the blank one how i want it. for the combat, i think i could figure it out, i just dont know where to look. i dont know what classes and files to look in.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with combat please

item.title: I need help with combat please
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If you are new to Java, then the worst thing you could (RSPS-wise) do is start with a blank source.

The reason that is, is because if there’s nothing there, you have nothing to learn from.

Example:
A server that has the logout packet functioning correctly would be a good benefit for someone who is attempting to understand the logout packet. They’d be able to reference that code as they write their own.

Combat is also one of the more complex sides of RSPS, so you may want to hold out on that until you know what you’re doing.
Start small. Start with the easy skills, like thieving from an object. Then move onto bigger once you’re better.

Read full topic
